message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.SD 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as it deals with the spread of false rumours on social media during emergencies. It could also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it describes the methodology and tool developed for the annotation of conversational threads to identify rumourous ones. Additionally, it could be classified under cs.CY (Computers and Society) as it deals with the impact of social media on citizens' well-being during emergencies. It could also be classified under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as it deals with the detection of false rumours that can jeopardize the security of citizens. Finally, it could be classified under cs.SD (Software Engineering) as it describes the development of a tool for the annotation of conversational threads.
